section.name: Unicode Setup
section.p: One of the best example for using UNICODE in Window 2000 and XP is you can create a Microsoft Word document, save it as HTML format, and load the file into your web server. Any one (include those using Mac, Windows 9x) can view the document without installing any Vietnamese font. However, in order to view a Vietnamese Word document, you must have Vietnamese language support in Window 2000/XP. There is no support for Windows 9x

ol.li: Open the Control Panel window using Start -->Settings-->Control Panel.
In "Control Panel" window, invoke Regional Options icon to open "Regional Options" dialog

In the Regional Options dialog, put a check for Vietnamese in the Language settings for the system (you need to scroll down to the option). Hit OK and Window 2000 will install Vietnamese language support. Prepare to have Windows 2000 installation CD ready. Restart your PC if asked. This step installs the software.
In the Input Locale tab, add VI for Vietnamese support. This step activates Vietnamese support.
Open the Regional and Language Option dialog using Start --> Control Panel --> Date, Time, Language, and Regional Options --> Regional and Language Option

In the Regional and Language Option dialog's Language tab, place a check for Install files for complex script and right to left language… and hit OK. Window XP will install a set of languages including Vietnamese. Prepare to have Windows XP installation CD ready. Restart your PC if asked.

In the Regional and Language Option dialog's Language tab, hit Details… button to open Text services and input language” dialog. In this dialog, hit Add button in Installed Services box to open Add Input Language dialog and select Vietnamese and US for Input Language and Keyboard Layout... respectively. Hit OK

section.name: Usage
section.p:
After adding Vietnamese language support to your Windows system, you should see EN (English) in the lower right task bar. Use Left-ALT Shift to toggle between EN and VI (Vietnamese) In VI mode:
numbers from 0 to 9 stand for đ, ă, â, ê, ô, ̀, ̉, ̃, ́, and ̣
[ and ] stand for ư and ơ.
Use normal shift key for capitalization.
